disputed.description: Concurrency/locking for bash globals — over-scoped for CLI tool
disputed.rationale: SDD already documents single-process assumption (Flatline IMP-001 from SDD review). Bash CLI tool is short-lived, not a daemon. Adding locking is disproportionate complexity.
Security negative tests are low-cost, high-value. Added as Task 1.10 with adversarial YAML fixtures.

blockers.concern: yq v4 dependency — single point of failure with escape hatch
blockers.rationale: Addressed by IMP-003 (yq version detection), LOA_ALLOW_DEFAULTS_WITHOUT_YQ illegal in CI, and explicit yq v4 check in Task 1.2.
Addressed by atomic _rt_append_route() helper and _rt_validate_array_lengths() invariant check in Task 1.1.
Addressed by whitespace trimming and empty-token rejection in _evaluate_conditions() in Task 1.3.

blockers.concern: Timeout/retry semantics can cause runaway execution
blockers.rationale: Addressed by bounds clamping (timeout 1-600s, retries 0-5), global max attempts cap (10), and explicit retry policy definition in Task 1.3.

blockers.concern: Security posture under-specified for untrusted YAML
blockers.rationale: Addressed by adversarial YAML security tests (Task 1.10), registry validation before execution, and bounds clamping on timeout/retries.
